intro: Cynanchum lineare, commonly known as the straight milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish, with a distinctive corolla that has five lobes. Cynanchum lineare is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
